image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from New York; born in New York City July 23, 1862; attended public schools; businessman, real estate and theatrical; member of the New York state assembly, 1886-1894; member of the New York state senate 1894-1903, 1909-1912; elected as a Democrat to the Fifty-eighth and to the succeeding Congress (March 4, 1903-July 27, 1906); resigned on July 27, 1906; elected as a Democrat to the Sixty-third Congress in 1912, but never took his seat; struck and killed on August 31, 1913, by a locomotive near Pelham Parkway, New York, N.Y.; interment in Calvary Cemetery, Long Island City, N.Y.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: New York (State) Legislature. Proceedings of the Legislature of the State of New York on the Life, Character and Public Service of Timothy D. Sullivan. Albany, N.Y.: [J. B. Lyon Company, printers, 1914].

United States. Congress (63d, 2d session: 1913-1914). Timothy D. Sullivan (late a Representative from New York) Memorial addresses delivered in the House of Representatives of the United States, Sixty-third Congress. Proceedings in the House, June 21, 1914. Proceedings in the Senate, September 15, 1913. Prepared under the direction of the Joint Committee on Printing. Washington: [Government Printing Office], 1914.
